isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - CAB FRONT MOUNTING BRACKET; REPLACE

wtsproc.config: Skirt removal is required if replacing right side mount bracket on a sleeper cab only. This will allow for access to remove the sleeper cab A/C line clipping bolts.

step1.para: Raise front axle, support with jack stand and remove wheel if vehicle is equipped with chassis skirts

note.para: If replacing right side mount bracket and vehicle is equipped with chassis skirts AND sleeper cab then remove aerodynamic chassis skirt panels in lieu of removing wheel

step1.para: Remove sleeper cab A/C refrigerant line clipping bolts and reposition lines (RIGHT SIDE WITH SLEEPER CAB ONLY). Cut tie straps and reposition air hose bundle from cab mount bracket (LEFT SIDE ONLY)
Position jack stand under cab and install bottle jack between jack stand and cab

note.para: Be careful to install bottle jack and stand in location that will not damage cab

step1.para: Remove front cab mount bushing lower cap & bolts

note.para: Do not raise cab higher than is necessary to remove bushing and mount bracket

step1.para: Install cab mount bracket & torque to spec
Install cab mount bushing & torque to spec
Install front cab mount bushing lower cap & bolts. Torque to spec
Install sleeper cab A/C refrigerant line clipping bolts (if equipped) (RIGHT SIDE WITH SLEEPER CAB ONLY). Install tie straps to secure air hose bundle (LEFT SIDE ONLY)
Install & torque wheel if vehicle is equipped with chassis skirts. Lower front axle assembly

note.para: If replacing right side mount bracket and vehicle is equipped with chassis skirts AND sleeper cab then install aerodynamic chassis skirt panels
